1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 from CartesianPositionController import CartesianPositionController
4 import numpy as np
5 import rospy
6 import tf
7 
8 NUMBER_OF_CONTROL_POINTS = 1
9 
10 # Parameters of the flacco paper
11 MAX_RATE = 1.0 # Obstacle velocity estimation equation
12 ALPHA = 6.0
13 C = 5.0
14 RHO = 0.4
15 V_MAX = 0.21
16 Q_DOT_MIN = np.array([-2.1750, -2.1750, -2.1750, -2.1750, -2.6100, -2.6100, -2.6100])
17 Q_DOT_MAX = np.array([+2.1750, +2.1750, +2.1750, +2.1750, +2.6100, +2.6100, +2.6100])
18 
19 
20 class ObstacleAvoidanceController(CartesianPositionController):
21  def __init__(self):
22  super(ObstacleAvoidanceController, self).__init__()
23  self.control_points = []
24  self.obstacle_points = [np.array([500, 500, 500])] # Very far away
25  self.Vi = np.zeros(3)
26 
27  def get_control_points(self):
28  """
29  Updates the location of the end_effector in self.position.
30  Updates the location of the control points in self.control_points.
31  """
32  self.control_points = []
33  while True:
34  try:
35  (trans, rot) = self.tf_listener.lookupTransform('world', 'end_effector', rospy.Time(0))
36  self.position = np.array(trans)
37  for i in range(NUMBER_OF_CONTROL_POINTS):
38  (trans, rot) = self.tf_listener.lookupTransform('world', 'control_point{}'.format(i), rospy.Time(0))
39  self.control_points.append(np.array(trans))
40  break
41 
42  except (tf.LookupException,
43  tf.ConnectivityException,
44  tf.ExtrapolationException):
45  continue
46 
47  def get_distance_vectors_end_effector(self):
48  """
49  Get distance vectors that go from obstacle points to the end effector
50 
51  Returns
52  -------
53  d_vectors: list
54  List of np.ndarray s, as many as obstacle points there are
55  """
56  d_vectors = []
57  number_of_obstacle_points = len(self.obstacle_points)
58  for j in range(number_of_obstacle_points):
59  d_vectors = d_vectors + [self.obstacle_points[j] - self.position]
60  return d_vectors
61 
62  def get_distance_vectors_body(self):
63  """
64  Get distance vectors that go from obstacle points to control points
65 
66  Returns
67  -------
68  D_vectors: list
69  List of lists that contain np.ndarrays, as many as obstacle points there are
70  """
71  D_vectors = []
72  number_of_control_points = len(self.control_points)
73  number_of_obstacle_points = len(self.obstacle_points)
74  for i in range(number_of_control_points):
75  d_vectors_i = []
76  for j in range(number_of_obstacle_points):
77  d_vectors_i = d_vectors_i + [self.obstacle_points[j] - self.control_points[i]]
78  D_vectors = D_vectors + [d_vectors_i]
79  return D_vectors
80 
81  def get_repulsive_distance(self):
82  """
83  Repulsive vector algorithm (Only distance information)
84 
85  Returns
86  -------
87  max_repulse_vector: np.ndarray
88  Repulsive vector that the algorithm computes having into account obstacle data
89  """
90  repulse_vector = []
91  distance_vectors = self.get_distance_vectors_end_effector()
92 
93  for D in distance_vectors:
94 
95  D_norm = np.linalg.norm(D)
96  D_unit_vec = D/D_norm
97 
98  v_mag_repulse = V_MAX * (1 / (1 + np.exp((D_norm * (2 / RHO) - 1) * ALPHA)))
99  v_repulse = v_mag_repulse * D_unit_vec
100 
101  repulse_vector.append(v_repulse)
102 
103  max_repulse_vector = self.search_largest_vector(repulse_vector)
104 
105  return max_repulse_vector
106 
107  def get_repulsive_distance_velocity(self):
108  """
109  Repulsive vector algorithm (distance and rate of change information)
110 
111  Returns
112  -------
113  max_repulse_vector: np.ndarray
114  Repulsive vector that the algorithm computes having into account obstacle data.
115  The angle of the vector is changed by this algorithm
116  """
117 
118  self.Vi = self.get_repulsive_distance()
119  try:
120  self.Vi_last
121  except AttributeError:
122  self.Vi_last = self.Vi
123 
124  Vi_dot = self.Vi - self.Vi_last
125  self.Vi_last = self.Vi
126 
127  Vi_dot_magnitude = np.linalg.norm(Vi_dot)
128 
129  np.divide(Vi_dot, Vi_dot_magnitude)
130 
131  if Vi_dot_magnitude != 0:
132  a = Vi_dot / Vi_dot_magnitude
133  else:
134  return self.Vi
135 
136  r = self.Vi / np.linalg.norm(self.Vi)
137  beta = np.arccos(np.dot(a, r))
138 
139  if beta > np.pi / 2:
140  return self.Vi # The obstacle is moving away from us. Don't use velocity information
141  else:
142  n = np.cross(a, r)
143  v = np.cross(n, a)
144  new_angle = beta - (np.pi/2 - beta) * np.exp(-(C * (2 / MAX_RATE * Vi_dot_magnitude - 1)))
145  V_new = np.linalg.norm(self.Vi) * (np.cos(new_angle) * a + np.sin(new_angle) * v)
146  return V_new
147 
148  def search_smallest_vector(self, vectors_list):
149  """
150  Algorithm that takes a list of vectors and returns the smallest
151 
152  Parameters
153  ----------
154  vectors_list : list
155  List of np.ndarrays
156 
157  Returns
158  -------
159  vectors_list[i]: np.ndarray
160  The smallest vector in vectors_list
161  """
162  norms = [np.linalg.norm(v) for v in vectors_list]
163  i = norms.index(min(norms))
164  return vectors_list[i]
165 
166  def search_largest_vector(self, vectors_list):
167  """
168  Algorithm that takes a list of vectors and returns the largest
169 
170  Parameters
171  ----------
172  vectors_list : list
173  List of np.ndarrays
174 
175  Returns
176  -------
177  vectors_list[i]: np.ndarray
178  The largest vector in vectors_list
179  """
180  norms = [np.linalg.norm(v) for v in vectors_list]
181  i = norms.index(max(norms))
182  return vectors_list[i]
183 
184  def select_most_restrictive(self, q_dot_max_list, q_dot_min_list):
185  """
186  This function gets a list of restriction vectors and returns the most restrictive combination
187 
188  Parameters
189  ----------
190  q_dot_max_list : list
191  list of restriction vectors
192  q_dot_min_list : list
193  list of restriction vectors
194 
195  Returns
196  -------
197  q_dot_min: np.ndarray
198  restriction vector
199  q_dot_max: np.ndarray
200  restriction vectors
201  """
202 
203  q_dot_max = np.array(Q_DOT_MAX)
204  q_dot_min = np.array(Q_DOT_MIN)
205  for i in range(7):
206  max_values = [vector[i] for vector in q_dot_max_list]
207  min_values = [vector[i] for vector in q_dot_min_list]
208  q_dot_max[i] = min(max_values)
209  q_dot_min[i] = max(min_values)
210  return (q_dot_min, q_dot_max)
211 
212  def end_effector_algorithm(self, xd_dot):
213  """
214  Algorithm that modifies the end effector velocity with the repulsive vectors, that depend on the obstacles sensed
215 
216  Parameters
217  ----------
218  xd_dot : np.ndarray
219  6x1 desired end effector velocity vector
220 
221  Returns
222  -------
223  xc_dot : np.ndarray
224  6x1 modified end effector velocity vector (Modified with obstacle information)
225  """
226  # Uncomment one of the following options to decide what algorithm you want to use
227  repulsive_vector = np.block([self.get_repulsive_distance(), np.array([0, 0, 0])])
228  # repulsive_vector = np.block([self.get_repulsive_distance_velocity(), np.array([0, 0, 0])])
229 
230  repulsive_vector.shape = (6, 1)
231 
232  xc_dot = xd_dot - repulsive_vector
233 
234  return xc_dot
235 
236  def body_algorithm(self):
237  """
238  Algorithm that computes the restrictions to joint velocities depending on obstacles data.
239 
240  Returns
241  -------
242  q_dot_min: np.ndarray
243  restriction vector
244  q_dot_max: np.ndarray
245  restriction vectors
246  """
247  D = self.get_distance_vectors_body()
248 
249  q_dot_max_list = []
250  q_dot_min_list = []
251 
252  for (i, distances_control_point_i) in enumerate(D):
253  smallest_distance = self.search_smallest_vector(distances_control_point_i)
254  distance_norm = np.linalg.norm(smallest_distance)
255  unit_distance = smallest_distance / distance_norm
256  # Risk function
257  f = 1 / (1 + np.exp((distance_norm * 2 / RHO - 1) * ALPHA))
258  # Get partial jacobian i
259  Jacobian_message = self.get_jacobian(self.q, 'control_point{}'.format(i))
260  J = np.array(Jacobian_message.J.J)
261  J.shape = (Jacobian_message.J.rows, Jacobian_message.J.columns)
262  # Risk vector projected in joint space
263  s = np.dot(np.linalg.pinv(J)[:, :3], unit_distance) * f
264  q_dot_max_i = np.array(Q_DOT_MAX)
265  q_dot_min_i = np.array(Q_DOT_MIN)
266  for i in range(len(s)):
267  if s[i] >= 0:
268  q_dot_max_i[i] = Q_DOT_MAX[i] * (1 - f)
269  else:
270  q_dot_min_i[i] = Q_DOT_MIN[i] * (1 - f)
271  q_dot_max_list = q_dot_max_list + [q_dot_max_i]
272  q_dot_min_list = q_dot_min_list + [q_dot_min_i]
273 
274  (q_dot_min, q_dot_max) = self.select_most_restrictive(q_dot_max_list, q_dot_min_list)
275 
276  return (q_dot_min, q_dot_max)
277 
278  def apply_restrictions(self, q_dot_min, q_dot_max):
279  """
280  Applies the restrictions contained in q_dot_min and q_dot_max to self.q_dot member of the controller
281 
282  Parameters
283  ----------
284  q_dot_min : [type]
285  [description]
286  q_dot_max : [type]
287  [description]
288  """
289  print('Before: {}'.format(np.array(self.q_dot)))
290  for i in range(7):
291  if self.q_dot[i] > q_dot_max[i]:
292  self.q_dot[i] = q_dot_max[i]
293  elif self.q_dot[i] < q_dot_min[i]:
294  self.q_dot[i] = q_dot_min[i]
295  print('After: {}'.format(np.array(self.q_dot)))
296  print("---------------")
297 
298  def go_to_point(self, position_desired):
299  """
300  Main function. Move to a point an stop when arrived
301 
302  Parameters
303  ----------
304  position_desired : numpy.ndarray
305  3x1 end effector desired position vector
306  Only position, not orientation
307  """
308  position_desired = np.array(position_desired)
309  self.error = position_desired - self.position
310  while np.linalg.norm(self.error) > self.error_threshold:
311  # Update lists
312  self.get_control_points()
313  self.get_obstacle_points()
314 
315  # Obtained the desired end effector velocity, in the case there were no obstacles
316  xd_dot = self.compute_command_velocity(position_desired)
317 
318  # Modify the velocity with the obstacles information
319  # Add flacco algorithm for end effector to get cartesian velocity xc_dot
320  xc_dot = self.end_effector_algorithm(xd_dot)
321  # xc_dot = xd_dot
322 
323  # Compute the corresponding joint velocities q_dot
324  self.q_dot = self.compute_command_q_dot(xc_dot)
325  # Compute the joint velocity restrictions and apply them
326  (q_dot_min, q_dot_max) = self.body_algorithm()
327  self.apply_restrictions(q_dot_min, q_dot_max)
328  # Publish velocities
329  self.panda_controller.send_velocities(self.q_dot)
330  self.rate.sleep()
331  self.stop()
332  return 0
333 
334  def get_obstacle_points(self):
335  """
336  In the future this will compute obstacle points.
337  Right now it's just a list of points to test the algorithm.
338  """
339  self.obstacle_points = np.array([[-0.1, 0.00013597, 0.47066]])
340 
341 
342 if __name__ == "__main__":
343 
344  obstacle_avoidance_controller = ObstacleAvoidanceController()
345  trajectory = np.array([[0.5, 0, 0.3], [0.8, 0, 0.3]])
346  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
347  obstacle_avoidance_controller.go_to_point(trajectory[0])
348  obstacle_avoidance_controller.go_to_point(trajectory[1])
